page.title: 06FARMING
page.content: A few farmers still produce hay bales, or roll the grass after cutting into huge rolls rather like a swiss roll. The rest of the land (a minority)is used on the stock farms for other {fodder}crops such as winter wheat or barley. The{wealth}in farming stems from a combination of fertile soil,favourable mild damp climate and gently sloping relief.The soil is derived from either red sandstone or a deep{red clay called Keuper marl.This red basis is particularly distinctive wherever the red clay is ploughed to show through into the landscape of green.The mild climate with winter temperatures usually well above freezing point (though this is an average figure..temperatures in February often seem to fall below freezing)and an annual rainfall of around 900-1000mms
